label: Dark Energy Evolution Parameter w_a
mathematical_goal: Derive the dark energy evolution parameter w_a ≈ -0.02 to -0.03 from G₂ moduli dynamics, comparing to DESI 2025 (w_a = -0.99 ± 0.38)
theoretical_significance: w_a governs the time evolution of dark energy in the CPL parameterization: w(z) = w₀ + w_a·z/(1+z). A non-zero w_a indicates dynamical dark energy (quintessence) rather than a static cosmological constant. PM predicts small w_a ~ -0.02 from three geometric mechanisms: (1) Gaussian pulse width σ/z_crit from pneuma stabilization, (2) topological correction b₃/χ_eff from 3-form saturation, and (3) holonomy rolling 2/k_gimel from modular evolution. All three give w_a ~ -0.02 to -0.03, indicating weak time dependence. DESI 2025 reports w_a = -0.99 ± 0.38, suggesting stronger evolution. However, the large uncertainty (38%) means PM is only ~2.6σ discrepant. This is the weakest PM cosmology prediction and may require higher-order corrections or coupling to matter fields.

cpl_parameterization.interpretation: Small |w_a| means slow evolution; dark energy nearly constant

derivation_chain: Start with w₀ = -11/13 from dimensional reduction

possible_resolutions.statistical_fluctuation: DESI uncertainty is 38%; more data may shift central value
possible_resolutions.systematic_effects: Supernova calibration, redshift evolution, selection biases
possible_resolutions.PM_corrections: Higher-order geometric terms, matter coupling, running effects
possible_resolutions.hybrid_model: w_a may have fast and slow components; PM captures slow part
possible_resolutions.observational_window: Current data spans z < 2; limited lever arm for w_a

future_tests.Euclid: Launch 2023, will measure w_a to ±0.1 by 2030
future_tests.Roman: Supernova and WL surveys, w_a precision ±0.08
future_tests.prediction: Future data will tighten w_a and test PM value ~-0.02
